meanings.definition: A person who makes mistakes or is clumsy in their work.
meanings.sent1: The bungler spilled paint all over the floor while trying to paint the wall.
meanings.sent2: The new employee was a bungler and constantly made errors in their reports.
meanings.sent3: The bungler accidentally put salt instead of sugar in the cake batter.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as a bungler in the kitchen spread like wildfire among his friends.
meanings.sent5: The bungler's constant mishaps turned the simple task into a comedy of errors.

meanings.definition: To work or act clumsily or incompetently.
meanings.sent1: She bunglered her way through the dance routine, tripping over her own feet.
meanings.sent2: He tends to bungle important presentations by forgetting key points.
meanings.sent3: The chef bunglered the recipe by mixing up the ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The team's lack of coordination caused them to bungle the final play of the game.
meanings.sent5: Despite his efforts, he continued to bungle every attempt at fixing the leaky faucet.
